author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
In K+S's realm of fertile ground,
Their wealth didst fall, fair fortune frowned;
Lower than spring, the year's gain found,
Sharp descent doth their hopes confound.

China, mighty dragon of trade,
Expels a maple leaf, dismayed;
Once partners strong, now friendship frayed,
By fickle politics, they're swayed.

Yet now upon the eastern shore,
A warning sign of commerce poor;
Exports cool in the mid-year's door,
Frost grips again, trade slows once more.

feedItems.title: K+S Cuts Guidance on Lower Potash Prices
feedItems.description: K+S shares fell sharply after the fertilizer company cut its outlook for 2023, warning it expects prices in its agriculture segment to be tangibly lower for the year as a whole than they were in the first quarter.

feedItems.title: China Expels Canadian Diplomat in Retaliatory Move
feedItems.description: The action is the latest salvo in turbulent relations between the two countries, once strong partners in trade whose ties have substantially been eroded by geopolitics.

feedItems.title: Chinese Exports Cool in Latest Warning Sign on Global Trade
feedItems.description: Chinese export growth slowed in April as global trade cooled.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
Of Aramco's profit sadly slides, its fate so cruel,
In oil's once prosperous reign, now cools the fool;
A pall on global markets, dear Russia lends its part,
As crude and wretched fortune weighs heavy on the heart.

Now UBS, in aim to seek a grander scene,
Doth set to wed fair Credit Suisse with schemes unseen;
Swiss voices question merits of such grand designs,
Lest separate units stay'd, or tyrant power declines.

A melancholy fall for Nintendo's might,
As Switch and software sales fade slow into the night;
A dreadful twenty-one percent our spirits shatter,
Leaving many pensiv' souls to question what's the matter.

feedItems.title: Saudi Aramco's Profit Slides as Oil Boom Cools
feedItems.description: The energy giant’s earnings fell 19% in the first quarter, as concerns over a slowing global economy and a gusher of cheaper Russian crude supplies weighed on oil prices.

feedItems.title: UBS Refreshes Management Team to Integrate Credit Suisse
feedItems.description: The Swiss banking giant said it is evaluating all options for Credit Suisse’s Swiss business, which some politicians in the country want to be spun off into a separate unit or divested.

feedItems.title: Nintendo Projects Profit Drop on Weaker Switch, Software Sales
feedItems.description: The Japanese company projected a 21% decline in fiscal-year net profit.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
In Endesa's court, the gold doth flow,
Above the forecasts, earnings grow,
Slight revenue decrease they bear,
Yet, for the year, their stance they swear.

The land of Nikkei, stocks ascend,
By steel and trade, gains they commend,
Strong corporate seeds, their branches reach,
In hopes of growth, their earnings teach.

Fresenius, with fortune disparate,
Revenues up, but profits abate,
To €787 million, operate,
Expecting growth, in single digit rate.

feedItems.title: Endesa Keeps Outlook After Strong First Quarter
feedItems.description: Endesa posted above-forecast underlying earnings of €1.5 billion in the first quarter, despite slightly lower revenue, and confirmed its guidance for the year.

feedItems.title: Nikkei Rises 1.0%, Led by Steel Stocks, Trading Houses
feedItems.description: Japanese stocks ended broadly higher, led by steel stocks and trading houses, as several strong corporate results raised hopes for earnings growth.

feedItems.title: Fresenius Profits Fall; Maintains Revenue Guidance
feedItems.description: Fresenius reported higher first-quarter sales but a drop in operating income to €787 million and said it continued to expect organic revenue to grow in a low-to-mid single digit percentage range.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
To market's mirth, the Fed dost nay tread,
Where optimism yields a rosy hue,
Yet DJE Kapital, in warning true,
Holds fast to duration, brief as ale's head.

Of Goldman Sachs, a tale of wrongs now fled,
Two hundred and fifteen million, a sum they rue,
An expert fair and just to guide them through,
As female workers find the scales balanced.

In UBS, a tale of twain banks entwined,
With Credit Suisse, a leader now is found,
Good Ulrich Koernēr, atop his mount,
And Todd Tuckner graced with ledger's crown.

feedItems.title: Market Looks More Optimistic About Rate Cuts Than Fed
feedItems.description: In general, the market is much more optimistic about interest-rate developments than the Fed, DJE Kapital said, which for the time being sticks to a rather short duration bias.

feedItems.title: Goldman Sachs to Pay $215 Million to Settle Female Employees' Discrimination Case
feedItems.description: The Wall Street bank will also engage an independent expert to review its pay practices and employee performance evaluations.

feedItems.title: UBS Outlines Leadership Team Ahead of Credit Suisse Deal
feedItems.description: UBS said Ulrich Koerner, current Credit Suisse CEO, will join the UBS executive board once the takeover is closed, while Todd Tuckner will take on the role of CFO.
